overview: A short film that recovers the LGTBI+ historical memory through the testimonies of seven women who, having lived their adolescence and youth during the Franco regime in Euskadi, became socialized as lesbians and feminists in a repressive and profoundly lesbophobic social context. They are women who are part of the first moments of a feminist movement that strongly claimed sexual freedom and the right of women to have the sexuality they wanted.
title: Lesv(i)sibles
